sentences: Päike kutsub meid välja parki käima.
context: The word 'kutsuvad' is the 3rd person plural present tense form of the Estonian verb 'kutsuda', which means 'to invite' or 'to summon'. It describes when someone (they) invites or calls others to do something. The dictionary entry provided appears to be about a different word ('koomiline'), so I'm analyzing this word based on its standard meaning in Estonian.
